answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!The swelling above the knee could be a hematoma, bursitis, arthritis, or muscle injury or due to deep vein thrombosis. It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. An X-ray or CT scan can tell for sure what swelling is. Your mother would need to consult an orthopedic specialist. There is no way she can treat this at home. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
Thank you Doctor...i will look into it and keep u posted...take care, Cy

question: Hi..my mother is 73 suffering from type 1 diabetes and high blood pressure. The area right above her knee is unnaturally swollen and she has a lot of pain for the past 3 months. What could this be due to and what treatment should she take. Thanks.
title: Swelling above the knee in a 73year old lady.
